--- title: "Data Visualisation" editor: visual --- Data visualisation plays a crucial role in the exploration of datasets. Specifically, it facilitates both exploratory data analysis and the generation of statistical plots. Through these visualizations, patterns, trends, and/or potential outliers within the data can be identified, aiding to understand the underlying relationships. Exploratory data analysis involves the initial visual inspection of data, while statistical plots encompass a range of graphics used to depict distributions, correlations, and statistical summaries. The `tidyverse` library is assumed to be loaded for all materials: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) ``` ::: ## Prepare 📖 [Exploratory Data Analysis](/contents/week-4/01_EDA.qmd) 📖 [Importance of data visualisation](/contents/week-4/02_importance_data_viz.qmd) 📖 [Statistical Plots](/contents/week-4/03_statistical_plots.qmd) ## Source code 🧑‍💻 [Source code](/contents/week-4/source/all_code_chunks.R) ## Questionnaire ⌨️ [Questionnaire](/questionnaire/qcm-week-4.qmd) ## Practice 📋 [Tutorials](/labs/lab-week-4.qmd) ⌨️ [Solution proposal](/labs/solutions/week-4.R)
